ngoList.title: Kalaangan
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Kalaangan is the labour of love of its founder Guru Moli Siddharth. From its humble beginning in the small North Eastern state of Agartala, it now has now expanded to the suburbs of Mumbai. It coaches around 120 students every year in the dance forms of Kathak and Rabindra Nritya primarily. Kalaangan offers undergraduate and post graduate diplomas in both Kathak and Rabindra Nritya for its students through the Akhil Bharatiya Gandharva Mahavidyalaya, Bangiya Sangeet Parishad and Pracheen Kala Kendra, Chandigarh. In addition, through the Kalaangan annual programmes and various other shows conceived and choreographed by Guruji students also get a flavour of other dance forms like Odissi, Manipuri and Bharat Natyam. Students also learn about the stalwarts of different dance forms, significance of old dance treatises like Natya Shastra. Kalaangan also encourages its senior students to spread their wings and teach under the guidance of Guruji. For the last two years Kalaangan has been organising an all India dance festival called â€˜Nazaaqatâ€™ in the memory of Guru Smt Moli Siddharthâ€™s Guru Late Padmashree Smt. Damayanti Joshi. This festival aims to bring together all the dancers of the different Gharanas of Kathak to keep the grace and beauty of this ancient art form alive. Kalaangan also begun a series of Kathak workshops under the name â€˜Paramparaâ€™. This workshop attempts to provide the students of Kalaangan and other students learning Kathak an opportunity for learning from some of the stalwart teachers of this dance form giving them a much more rounded experience. Guru Smt Moli Siddharthâ€™s dream is to take the concept of dance as a form of expression and as a method of overall personal development and confidence building technique for the marginalized children in our neighborhoods. With this aim in mind, she, along with her senior students , has started classes for the children of the domestic help, construction workers and other daily wage workers around her teaching Kathak and communication skills in English so that they can create a place for themselves in the society. This inititiative is called Prayaas. Kalaanagan and its senior students have performed in India in Mumbai, Delhi, Kolkata, Bhopal and Nagpur amongst the places. It recenty performed as an invitee of the India Tourism Board of Paris in the IViagitorri , a travel and tourism based exposition in Lugano, Switzerland.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: We have come a long way after a small beginning in December ninety eighty six and in a span of few eventful years we have implemented a wide variety of projects covering activities like watershed development, wasteland development, tribal development, low cost sanitation, self help groups, projects for women up liftment and employment generated training program, etc. While implementing different developmental projects, our thrust has always been to secure peoples participation. At KMAGVS we have always believed in the capacities and capabilities of the communities and have always strive to channel hidden and dormant energies of the people for the betterment of the societies at large. Our efforts have always been directed in the direction of creating an environment conducive of giving opportunities to local people to think and act positively. We have always endeavored to develop skills and competencies of local communities with a view to enabling them to manage, operate and maintain the assets, created through the implementation of various projects on sustainable basis. KMAGVS is working in Latur, Beed, Osmanabad and Parbhani districts in the Marathwada region in Maharashtra state. It has its head office in Latur and branch offices at Pangaon and Parli. It has worked with the most marginalized communities in these regions on the themes of agriculture, natural resource management, NRM, land rights, labour rights, micro-finance, in relation to agriculture and land rights, primary education and child rights. Under NRM, KMAGVS has significant experience in watershed development. It has been implementing the Indo German Watershed Development Program, IGWDP since nineteen ninety six at Latur and Beed districts with financial and technical association from WOTR and NABARD in two villages covering three thousand nine hundred eighty six hectares of land and one thousand and forty three beneficiaries. The work of KMAGVS has been appreciated by the state government as well as donor agencies and NGO networks. Its unique strengths have been an inclusive and participatory approach, focused on mainstreaming gender in every intervention and a constant learning approach. It has taken optimum benefit of the support of expert consultants like BASIX, NABARD, Oxfam and others by using their services to develop knowledge and skills of its own team and beneficiaries Another important project of our long social journey was watershed development. Watershed development projects by us is designed to harmonize the use of water, soil, forest and pasture resources in a way that conserves these resources while raising agricultural productivity, both through in situ moisture conservation and increased irrigation through tank and aquifer based water harvesting. The project is initiated in the year in two villages of the district named gadadewadi and kadewadi.

ngoList.ngoName: Konkan bamboo and cane development centre
ngoList.address: C/o. Native Konbac Bamboo Products Pvt. Ltd. B-9, MIDC, Kudal, Tal. Kudal, Dist. Sindhudurg, State - Maharashtra, 416520
ngoList.title: Konkan bamboo and cane development centre
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The Konkan Bamboo and Cane Development Centre (KONBAC) was established to implement the programme, which aimed to enhance rural livelihoods, while addressing local, crosscutting social and economic challenges, such as dependence on rain-fed agriculture, male urban migration, caste prejudices and low market demand. The Sindhudurg and Ratnagiri districts of Konkan division pose a development challenge, as the majority of rural residents depend on a single, rain-fed, short agriculture season. Lack of year-round employment opportunities is a major cause of poverty, leading to seasonal migration of males. The action research programme has incrementally changed social perceptions of bamboo as a cheap and low-class material. To promote such changes, the action research programme relied on training and capacity building of local communities, particularly empowering local women as income earners (women comprise two-thirds of the rural workforce). At present, the Konkan action research programme of KONBAC has made considerable progress in developing into a self-sustaining institutional ecosystem. Although certain issues relating to working capital and capacity expansion still exist, KONBAC is well on the way to solving these, and has already emerged as a model that is being emulated elsewhere in India and abroad. The work conducted by KONBAC during the last 05 years has led to establishment of several facilities/ areas of expertise (both infrastructure based and human resource based) within the Organisation. They are highlighted below: NO. FACILITY PARTICULARS 1 Bamboo Training and Product Development Centre Sponsored by National Mission for Bamboo Development (NMBA), Dept. of Science and Technology, Govt. of India 2 Bamboo Common Facility Centre for primary processing Sponsored by Development Commissioner â€“ Handicraft, Ministry of Textile, Government of India 3 Bamboo Research and Development Centre Sponsored by INBAR and International Fund for Agricultural Development (IFAD) 4 Bamboo Pressure Impregnation Treatment Plant Sponsored by National Mission for Bamboo Development (NMBA), Dept. of Science and Technology, Govt. of India 5 Bamboo Technology Development Centre Sponsored by National Bamboo Mission, Ministry of Agriculture, Government of India 6 Bamboo based Hygiene Product Manufacturing Unit Sponsored by National Mission for Bamboo Development (NMBA), Dept. of Science and Technology, Govt. of India 7 Bamboo based Power Generation Unit Sponsored by National Mission for Bamboo Development (NMBA), Dept. of Science and Technology, Govt. of India 8 Bamboo Furniture Manufacturing Unit Self sponsored 9 Bamboo Craft Manufacturing Unit Self sponsored 10 Bamboo Construction Technology Demonstration Unit Self sponsored 11 Bamboo waste based Briquette Manufacturing Units Sponsored by National Mission for Bamboo Development (NMBA), Dept. of Science and Technology, Govt. of India 12 Bamboo based Charcoal Manufacturing Unit Sponsored by National Mission for Bamboo Development (NMBA), Dept. of Science and Technology, Govt. of India 13 Bamboo Construction components, Fabrication and Erection Unit Self sponsored 14 Bamboo Nursery Establishment Self sponsored Expertise in each of above-mentioned areas has made KONBAC a World Leader in the area of bamboo development.
